title: Ukraine crisis: Key moments in Russia's military build-up
description: As Vladimir Putin orders troops into eastern Ukraine, here's a look at how things got to this point.

title: Mickelson to take break from game after 'reckless' comments on Saudi Arabia
description: Phil Mickelson "sincerely regrets" his criticism of Saudi Arabia's regime and will take a break from the game "to work on becoming the man I want to be".

title: Deeney calls for teaching of diverse history to be made mandatory in schools
description: Birmingham captain Troy Deeney calls for the teaching of black, Asian and minority ethnic history and experiences to be made mandatory across the school curriculum.

title: Lost dog survives stormy days on mountains
description: Molly the springer spaniel is home, thanks to some ham, after going missing during Storm Franklin.

title: Putin dresses down Russia's spy chief
description: Russian president presses Sergei Naryshkin during a meeting with top security officials.

title: Ukraine crisis: Vladimir Putin address fact-checked
description: BBC News looks into several claims the Russian president made about Ukraine.

title: Russia's plan to fight back against Western sanctions
description: President Putin has made changes to protect the Russian economy since it first was hit by sanctions in 2014.

title: Soggy moggy pulled from river
description: The RNLI is called out to try to rescue a tomcat who is stuck in the River Bure.

title: Ukraine: What are Russia's possible attack routes?
description: Western governments think Russian troops could go much further than east Ukraine.

title: The Hundred: Domestic and international stars retained for 2022 competition
description: The Hundred men's and women's teams announce which players they have retained for the 2022 competition.

title: Ukraine-Russia tensions: Oil surges on supply fears
description: Crude oil prices rise on Ukraine crisis, prompting warnings of higher UK petrol prices.

title: West Midlands hit by earthquake
description: The 2.8 magnitude quake could be felt over a 12-mile radius from the Walsall epicentre.

title: Boris Johnson promises first set of UK sanctions against Russia
description: Boris Johnson says the measures will hit Russia "very hard", after it ordered troops into eastern Ukraine.

title: UK storms: Flooding and more rain may hamper recovery efforts
description: The West Midlands has a severe flood warning and poor weather could slow clean-ups across the UK.

title: River Severn Flooding: Homes and businesses evacuated
description: A major incident has been declared in towns in Worcestershire and Shropshire.

title: Ukraine crisis: Russia orders troops into rebel-held regions
description: Moscow's move to recognise two separatist regions and send in soldiers has drawn wide condemnation.

title: Uefa likely to move Champions League final from St Petersburg as Ukraine-Russia crisis escalates
description: Uefa is almost certain to switch the this season's Champions League final away from St Petersburg amid the Ukraine-Russia crisis.

title: Covid: Queen cancels virtual engagements as she recovers
description: She still has symptoms but will continue working on light duties, Buckingham Palace says.

title: Fossil of largest Jurassic pterosaur found on Skye
description: A student on a field trip finds the world's largest complete fossil of a 170-million-year-old pterosaur.

title: Oti Mabuse to leave Strictly Come Dancing after seven years
description: The South African star is the only dancer to lift the show's glitterball trophy two years in a row.

title: Covid: Sajid Javid defends timing of end to Covid rules and free tests
description: It is a historic moment, the health secretary says - but he warns we must be ready for more variants.

title: Whyte signs contract to fight Fury with bout expected at Wembley in April
description: British heavyweight Dillian Whyte signs a contract to fight WBC champion Tyson Fury, with the bout expected to take place in April, potentially at Wembley Stadium.

title: Inflation sends UK debt interest payments higher
description: Interest payments on government borrowing topped £6bn last month, the highest on record for a January.

title: Jamal Edwards: Fans mourn music pioneer at Acton vigil
description: Crowds pay their respects at a mural of the entrepreneur, who died on Sunday at the age of 31.

title: Online subscription scams costing UK victims millions
description: Many of the scams lure victims in with fake adverts on Facebook, seemingly backed by celebrities.

title: Putin's angry speech rewriting Ukraine's history
description: In an hour-long televised speech, the Russian leader made accusations, grievances and challenges.

title: Wunderkids: Building football’s most exciting young XI - week two: Florian Wirtz, winger
description: A new BBC Sounds podcast is building football's most exciting young XI - the focus of the second episode is a player who has been called the new Kai Havertz in his native Germany.

title: Hedgehog population plummets in UK countryside, research suggests
description: The population of hedgehogs in rural Britain has continued a "steep decline", say conservationists.

title: The Papers: Putin 'warns of bloodshed' and pay for Covid tests
description: The front pages cover Russia moving troops into Ukraine and the UK scrapping free virus testing.

title: OnlyFans accused of conspiring to blacklist rivals
description: ​​OnlyFans is accused of conspiring with an unidentified social media company to disable accounts of adult performers working for rivals.

title: Ant and Dec in drag: 'This will change LGBTQ+ children's lives'
description: Dec's make-up artist says seeing drag on a family TV show will do wonders for LGBTQ+ representation.

title: Neom: What's the green truth behind a planned eco-city in the Saudi desert?
description: Saudi Arabia - one of the world's biggest oil producers - says it's pivoting to green energy. But will reality live up to the rhetoric?

title: The 'window' saving families from domestic violence
description: How Iceland uses a 24-hour window to tackle domestic violence

title: The mobile phones you can take apart and repair yourself
description: Phones you repair yourself are increasingly popular, and are attracting an enthusiastic following.

title: Cornwall: I have to live in an Airbnb in my hometown
description: In Cornwall, no-fault evictions and a boom in holiday lets have led to locals facing homelessness.

title: 'I've been taking a photo every day at 12.34pm for 10 years'
description: Samuel Ryde has tried to take a photograph every day at the same time for 10 years. Why?

title: 'I saw my daughter's heart rate reach 280bpm'
description: Evelyn, two, who was diagnosed with a rare genetic heart condition, has had a defibrillator fitted.
